page.title: 06STOKE CHURCH
page.content: In 1985 the people of Stoke Church were struggling to increase the small congregation and to maintain their ancient building with this latter task proving much the easier. Raising money for roof and belfrey repairs through coffee mornings, jumble sales, flower festivals and wine and cheese parties is being successful since the building retains a place in the affection of the villagers. Many children have been baptized, weddings solemnized and these ceremonies have forged a link between Church and village. The Gospel of Christ is much less treasured and Stoke only has the one service each Sunday. The Worship is a variety of modern services and the much loved hymns and chants of past years. Hopefully such a pattern will help people of different ages to draw close to God.
